docs.snippet: Rochelle Sterling would negotiate a sale of the Los Angeles Clippers in an effort to avoid a protracted battle with the N.B.A., according to a person close to the discussions....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rochelle Sterling would negotiate a sale of the Los Angeles Clippers in an effort to avoid a protracted battle with the N.B.A., according to a person close to the discussions.
docs.abstract: Embattled Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling signals that he may try to empower his wife, Rochelle, to negotiate the sale of the team; choice comes as a surprising turn in monthlong scandal, and would avert a protracted legal battle

headline.main: In Twist, Sterling May Allow His Wife to Sell the Clippers
headline.print_headline: In Twist, Sterling May Allow Wife to Sell

docs.snippet: Mark Cuban, the owner of the Mavericks, sounded somewhat tone deaf while admitting that he harbors prejudice....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mark Cuban, the owner of the Mavericks, sounded somewhat tone deaf while admitting that he harbors prejudice.
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column criticizes tone-deaf, racially prejudiced comments from Dallas Mavericks owner Mark Cuban; argues that comments have cast all NBA owners in a bad light at crucial time when league is reeling from scandal surrounding Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling.

headline.main: Cuban Talks His Way Onto a Limb Occupied by Sterling
headline.print_headline: Cuban Talks His Way Onto a Limb Occupied by Sterling

docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands gathered on the campus of Northern State University in South Dakota on Saturday for a memorial service to honor longtime college basketball coach Don Meyer, whose friends said his legacy of compassion for others would surpass even his accomplishments on the court.

headline.main: Thousands Attend Service for Coach Don Meyer
